etymology.description: Pictogram (象形) – fontanelle; see also 𡿺 and its simplification 㐫; unrelated to 离.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts the soft spot on an infant’s skull, visually indicating an opening at the crown. Related historical forms include 𡿺 and its simplified 㐫; despite superficial similarity, it is not connected to 离.

examples.chinese: 婴儿的囟门尚未闭合(嬰兒的囟門尚未閉合)。
examples.english: The baby's fontanelle has not yet closed.

examples.chinese: 医生轻触前囟，评估颅内压力(醫生輕觸前囟，評估顱內壓力)。
examples.pinyin: Yīshēng qīngchù qiánxìn, pínggū lú nèi yālì.
examples.english: The doctor gently touches the anterior fontanelle to assess intracranial pressure.

examples.chinese: 民间把头顶的软处称作囟(民間把頭頂的軟處稱作囟)。
examples.pinyin: Mínjiān bǎ tóudǐng de ruǎnchù chēngzuò xìn.
examples.english: People commonly call the soft spot on the crown of the head ‘xìn’.
